channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL THE DECLARED HAZMAT WAS ON THE FLOOR WITH THE BOTTOM EDGES OF THE BOX WET. RESPONDER APPROACHED THE DECLARED HAZMAT WEARING FULL PPE. ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS SAFELY PLACED ON THE PITO-CART, RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024040113
item.description:
Report E-2024040113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced an over the road release of UN1866 Tremco Puma Primer from a 6-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released due to a broken pallet puncturing the pail. The majority of the release impacted a 6’ x 4’ area of the wooden trailer floor with approximately 1 cup impacting a 3” x 6” area of the gravel rocks below the trailer. The damaged pail was collected with oil dri into a 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbent pads were then used to clean the impacted trailer and crew utilized hand tools to scrap up the impacted rocks. The impacted rags, damaged pallet, impacted gravel rocks, PPE, and poly were placed into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported back to the XPO terminal in Phoenix, AZ for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040093
item.description:
Report X-2024040093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED OUT FOR A HAZMAT LEAKER THAT WAS LOCATED AT THE IRREG LINE IR2. ONCE THE RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE, THEY GATHERED A LINED SPILL TRAY AS WELL AS DONNING ALL APPROPRIATE PPE REQUIRED FOR THE HAZMAT LEAK. RESPONDER FOLLOWED STEPS ACCORDING TO THE DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SAFELY PUT THE HAZMAT INSIDE THE LINED SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO THE RESPONDER CAGE FOR PROPER PROCCESSING.
